title: What is the greenhouse effect?
text: The greenhouse effect is the warming of a planet due to gases like carbon dioxide and methane that trap heat in the atmosphere. Sunlight warms the surface; some heat is radiated back to space, but greenhouse gases absorb and re-emit this heat, keeping the lower atmosphere warmer.

title: Where does CO₂ come from?
text: Major sources include burning fossil fuels for electricity, heat, and transport; industrial processes like cement; and land-use changes. Natural sinks such as forests and oceans remove some CO₂ each year.

title: What can I do today?
text: Choose low-carbon transport when possible, reduce food waste, shift some meals toward plant-rich options, improve home energy efficiency, and support community efforts like tree-planting or clean energy projects.
